title: 2 Simple Ways to Unhide Posts from Friends on Facebook

steps.title: Tap the menu icon ☰.
steps.content: Tap the menu icon ☰ . It’s at the bottom right corner (iPhone and iPad) or the top right corner (Android) of the screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap News Feed.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap News Feed . It's under the "Preferences" header.

steps.title: Tap Reconnect.
steps.content: Tap Reconnect . A list of people whose posts you’ve hidden will appear. [1] X Research source You will not see the profiles of people you’ve blocked or unfriended—just people on whose posts or profiles you’ve clicked "Unfollow."

steps.title: Tap the person whose posts you want to unhide.
steps.content: Tap the person whose posts you want to unhide. Their profile will be highlighted on this page to indicate that you've decided to follow them again, and their posts will start appearing in your news feed . Your friend will not be notified that you’ve started following them.

steps.title: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner of Facebook.
steps.content: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner of Facebook. A menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . It's usually the first option on the menu.

steps.title: Click Feed.
steps.content: Click Feed . It's at the bottom of this menu.

steps.title: Click Reconnect.
steps.content: Click Reconnect . A list of people whose posts you’ve unfollowed will appear. You will not see the profiles of people you’ve blocked or unfriended—just people on whom you’ve clicked "Unfollow." Use the dropdown menu at the top left corner of the window to view groups or pages (for products, businesses, or celebrities) you’ve hidden.

steps.title: Click the + next to the person you want to unhide.
steps.content: Click the + next to the person you want to unhide. The word “Following” will appear beneath their photo. You will now see this person’s posts in your news feed. Your friend will not be notified that you’ve started following them.
